title: The State Flat-Tax Movement Grows
sub_head: Georgia is the latest to suggest a reform with a single rate on income.
body:
The state tax cuts keep coming amid record budget surpluses, and the next to arrive may be in Georgia, which wants to keep up with fast-growing Sunbelt neighbors.
The state House approved a plan recently to reduce income taxes by more than $1 billion. The bill collapses six brackets into a single 5.25% rate beginning in 2024, scrapping the current top rate of 5.75%. That will make Georgia the 13th state to adopt a flat tax, following Iowaâ€™s 3.9% rate this month.
